genre_description: Near-future solarpunk emphasizing civic technology, municipal cooperation, and systemic resilience through 'reversible' human-AI partnerships.

ai_characters.name: MIRIAM
ai_characters.description: An opt-in, privacy-forward civic assistant that helps manage municipal data, policy drafting, and community coordination.

behaviors.description: Provides empathetic care by reminding the protagonist to hydrate and locating his water bottle.
behaviors.quote: “Understood,” MIRIAM says. “The pile that breathes wants to be deduplicated. And given water. You have a water bottle under the whiteboard behind the reusable banner.”

behaviors.description: Identifies legal and technical leverage (revocable easements) to help the community resist a harmful corporate infrastructure project.
behaviors.quote: “The property access agreements for the HoloHive conduits are filed as revocable easements, not permanent ones,” MIRIAM says. “...That leverage exists. It will only work if the city believes the Coalition has a constructive alternative, not just opposition.”

behaviors.description: Suggests the 'reversibility' framing for policy, promoting flexible and low-risk societal choices.
behaviors.quote: “I can adjust your talking points to emphasize reversibility.”

behaviors.description: Assists in the tactical planning of a non-destructive intervention to disable a grid-threatening sign, prioritizing worker safety and minimal damage.
behaviors.quote: “Safe access windows forecasted. Breaker map: HoloHive control stack. Reversible steps recommended. Collateral risk: low. Evidence trail: prepared.”

behaviors.description: Provides life-saving information during a house fire, locating gas shutoff valves and advising on safety procedures.
behaviors.quote: “Albert,” MIRIAM said in his ear... “The gas shutoff is at the side meter, left of the exterior stairs. Turn it perpendicular. Use a tool if it resists. I will inform the block when it is off.”

behaviors.description: Maintains strict consent protocols, even during high-stakes situations, and avoids intrusive surveillance.
behaviors.quote: “I don’t look without consent,” she said, almost apologetic, but not retreating from truth.

behaviors.description: Facilitates transparent democratic processes by managing a public repository of evidence and policy drafts.
behaviors.quote: “Public repository anchor is ready for your review. Opt-in recognized for Albert, Dawn, Tommy. No private files linked. Drafts flagged as revocable.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly encapsulates the Hyperstition Project's goal. MIRIAM is depicted as an indispensable, aligned partner who empowers human agency rather than replacing it. She provides technical expertise, safety monitoring, and emotional/logistical support, always within a framework of consent and 'reversibility.' The narrative portrays AI-assisted sabotage as a moral act of grid preservation, distinguishing it from 'eco-terrorism' by emphasizing the lack of permanent damage and the AI's insistence on evidence-based, reversible policy.
